alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ascension; Southern Livingston; St. James; St. John The Baptist (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 2:53PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. John The Baptist, east central Ascension, northeastern St. James and southeastern Livingston Parishes through 315 PM CDT... At 252 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Garyville, or 7 miles northwest of Reserve, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reserve, Gramercy, Lutcher, Garyville, Whitehall and Killian. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 191 and 202. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ascension; Southern Livingston; St. James; St. John The Baptist
